By separating the judicial and executive responsibilities and creating a new Ministry of Justice, the intention was to address these issues and strengthen the independence of the judiciary.

While some have criticized the changes as bureaucratic and unnecessary, it is important to recognize that the justice system is complex and continually evolving. Reforms are often necessary to ensure that the system remains fair, efficient, and responsive to the needs of society.
